title: Single-page link-in-bio with booking and newsletter signup

requirements.summary: Build a single-page link-in-bio layout with profile header, social links, primary booking button, and newsletter signup section.
acceptanceCriteria: The app renders as a single page with clearly separated sections for socials, booking, and newsletter signup.
Social links are displayed as a vertical list of buttons/tiles and open in a new tab.
A dedicated Booking button is visually primary and opens its configured URL in a new tab.
Newsletter section contains an email input and a submit button and is usable on mobile and desktop.

file_operations.description: Create the single-page app shell and render the LinkInBioPage as the only view (no additional routes/pages) to satisfy the single-page requirement.

Implement the link-in-bio page sections (profile header, socials list, primary booking button, newsletter signup section). Use shadcn-ui components (e.g., Button, Card, Input) for consistent UI composition—verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Create a focused component that renders the configured social links as a vertical list of button/tiles that open in a new tab. Use shadcn-ui Button (or equivalent) for the tiles—verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Create a dedicated visually-primary booking button component that opens the configured booking URL in a new tab. Use shadcn-ui Button styling/composition—verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Create the newsletter signup UI section (email input + submit button) and integrate it into the page layout. Use shadcn-ui Input and Button for form controls—verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Add a single developer-editable configuration module for profile text, social links, booking URL, and optional footer text.
acceptanceCriteria: There is a single obvious place (e.g., one config object/module) where profile text, social links, and booking URL can be edited.
Changing the configuration updates the rendered page without additional code changes elsewhere.

file_operations.description: Create a single exported config object/module containing profile name/tagline, optional avatar override, social links array, booking URL, and optional footer text; keep this as the single source of editable content.
Wire LinkInBioPage to read all page content (header, socials, booking, footer) exclusively from frontend/src/linkBioConfig.ts so content changes only require editing the config module.
Accept the social links array as props (sourced from frontend/src/linkBioConfig.ts) and render it without hardcoded values to keep configuration centralized.
Accept booking URL (and optional label) as props (sourced from frontend/src/linkBioConfig.ts) to keep configuration centralized.

requirements.summary: Implement newsletter signup submission with client-side validation and inline success/error states, calling the backend capability to store subscriptions.
acceptanceCriteria: Submitting an empty email shows an inline validation error and does not send a request.
Submitting an invalid email format shows an inline validation error and does not send a request.
Submitting a valid email shows a success state after the backend confirms storage.
If the backend call fails, the UI shows a non-technical error message and allows retry.

file_operations.description: Add simple client-side validation helpers (required + email format) that return user-friendly messages; keep logic reusable and testable.
Create a small frontend wrapper that exposes the backend newsletter-join call using the existing core-infrastructure backend connection setup (no backend changes in this plan).
Create a hook that manages newsletter submission state (idle/submitting/success/error), invokes the backend join call, and returns state + submit handler to the UI.

Integrate validation (required + email format) and wire submit to the useNewsletterSignup hook; show inline validation errors, inline success message on confirmed completion, and a non-technical retryable error state on failure. Use shadcn-ui Input/Button (and optional Alert) for consistent inline states—verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Apply a coherent responsive visual theme (non-blue/non-purple primary palette) across header, buttons, and form controls.
acceptanceCriteria: The UI has a consistent theme across header, buttons, and form controls (typography, spacing, radii, shadows).
Theme uses a non-blue/non-purple primary palette (e.g., warm neutrals with a single accent).
Layout is responsive and remains readable and attractive on small screens.

file_operations.description: Add global Tailwind/shadcn token variables and base styles that establish a warm neutral theme with a single non-blue/non-purple accent; ensure typography/spacing/radii/shadows are consistent across the page.
Adjust theme extensions if needed to support the chosen non-blue/non-purple palette and consistent container/spacing behavior (keeping existing shadcn token approach intact).

Apply responsive layout classes (max width, vertical spacing, section separation) and consistent button/input styling across all sections using composed shadcn-ui components—verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Use the generated static background and default avatar images from frontend public assets (no backend fetching).
acceptanceCriteria: The page uses the generated background image and default avatar image from frontend/public/assets/generated.
Images load without backend calls and appear correctly in production build.

file_operations.description: Render the generated images as static assets: use frontend/public/assets/generated/linkbio-bg.dim_1600x900.png for a subtle page background and frontend/public/assets/generated/avatar-placeholder.dim_512x512.png as the default avatar when no avatar is configured.
Include an optional config field to override the avatar while defaulting to the generated asset at frontend/public/assets/generated/avatar-placeholder.dim_512x512.png.

Ensure global styling supports the background treatment (e.g., background sizing/positioning) while keeping the image source as the static asset at frontend/public/assets/generated/linkbio-bg.dim_1600x900.png.
